intro: Tetraplasandra gymnocarpa var. leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-fruited pandanus, is a rare and unique member of the Pandanaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and long, narrow leaves that are often aromatic. Its fruit is small, capsule-like, and typically contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
